Description: Pottery ostracon: inscribed in Aramaic on both surfaces.
Curator's comments: According to the handwriting it was written by the same person who composed some thirty other ostraca around 475 BC (Naveh 1970: 36-7). These messages seem to concern travel of goods, people, or messages by boat between Syene and Elephantine in Egypt. Syene and Elephantine were garrisoned, respectively, by regular units of Aramaean and Judean soldiers of the Persian army, who lived there with their families. The boats were known by the names of their Egyptian owners. Published: J. Curtis and N. Tallis (eds.), Forgotten Empire: The World of Ancient Persia, London 2005, p. 198 [312].
Bibliographic references: Porten B & Yardeni A 1991a / Three Unpublished Aramaic Ostraca (pp.207-27, figs. 1-2, pls. 1-2)
Curtis & Tallis 2005 / Forgotten Empire: The world of Ancient Persia (cat. 312)
Naveh 1970 / The Development of the Aramaic Script
